Lab Diagnostics Center Manager Job at You Centred Consulting




        
    

        
        You Centred Consulting is a forward-thinking technology company based in Lagos, Nigeria, committed to fostering a smarter and more connected economy. We specialize in software development for the Insurance, Financial, and Health Management Organization (HMO) sectors within Nigeria, with an ambitious vision to expand our services across Africa. Our experienced team is dedicated to customer success, delivering top-tier project services through innovative, precise, and effective solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Lab Diagnostics Center Manager
Job Location: Lagos

Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for an organized, people?focused leader to run the day?to?day operations of our medical?lab diagnostic center.
	You’ll oversee staff, ensure quality results, keep the lab compliant, and drive growth while maintaining a patient?first culture.


Key Responsibilities


	Team Leadership– Recruit, train, schedule, and mentor a team of technologists, phlebotomists, and support staff; conduct performance reviews.
	Quality & Compliance– Implement and monitor CLIA, CAP, ISO?15189, and local regulations; lead internal audits and proficiency testing.
	Operations Management– Manage workflow, turnaround times, and equipment maintenance; optimize staffing to meet volume fluctuations.
	Financial Oversight– Prepare budgets, track expenses, and drive revenue by expanding test menus and improving billing processes.
	Customer Service– Serve as the primary point of contact for physicians, patients, and insurance providers; resolve issues promptly and professionally.
	Continuous Improvement– Analyze KPIs, identify bottlenecks, and introduce lean or Six?Sigma initiatives to boost efficiency and accuracy.
	Technology Integration– Evaluate and rollout new diagnostic instruments, LIS upgrades, and data?management tools.


Qualifications


	Minimum of?2 years of progressive experience in a clinical lab, with at least? a year in a supervisory or managerial role.
	Familiarity with laboratory accreditation standards.
	Strong budget?management and staffing skills; proficient with LIS and standard lab software.


Essential Skills:


	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Detail?oriented with a solid grasp of quality?control principles.
	Decisive problem?solver comfortable with data?driven decision?making.
	Ability to multitask in a fast?paced, high?volume environment.


Work Conditions:


	Full?time, Monday?Friday, with occasional weekend or on?call coverage for emergencies.
	On?site presence required; occasional travel to regional clinics or conferences.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send in their CV to: careers.youcentredconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Manager (Audit) Job at University Press PLC




        
    

        
        University Press PLC (UPPLC) was founded in 1949 under the name of Oxford University Press Nigeria, and has grown to become one of the oldest, most experienced and the Nation’s Foremost Publishers of materials for educational and for general reading. At incorporation as a public liability company in 1978,the Company’s name was changed to University Press Limited with anauthorisedshare capital of 8,000,000 Ordinary shares of 50k each. Quoted on the Nigerian Stock Exchange on 14th August 1978, UPPLC has, on two occasions, won the prestigious Stock Exchange MeritAward in the service sector of quoted companies. It has also won, for two consecutive years, 1984 and 1985, the Concord Prize for Excellence in Academic Publishing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager (Audit)

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Supervise all audit staff and activities of department
	Undertake regular audit of company operations as scheduled
	Ensure sound internal audit control
	Prepare audit reports in line with internal requirements
	Liaise with external auditors
	Notify management of areas of shortcoming and advise accordingly.


Qualification & Required Skills


	A First Degree (B.Sc./HND) in Accounting with a minimum of Second-Class Lower Division / Lower Credit.
	A minimum of 5 - 10 years of relevant experience in an Internal Audit role, with at least 2 years in a managerial capacity.
	Possession of a relevant professional qualification such as ICAN or ACCA is Mandatory.
	Strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Proven ability to pay attention to detail and maintain high standards of accuracy and integrity.
	Must be not more than 40 years of age.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Auditor",
  "description": "At Elvaridah, we emphasize on the critical matters and prospects of organizations such as business growth, strategy, planning, marketing, structure, and people management across different industries. We help companies focus on the growth of their businesses while aligning costs with strategy. With our all-inclusive approach and expertise, we capture values across the boundaries of any organization. Elvaridah focuses on optimizing all the different parts of a business as a unit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Auditor
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Internal Audit / Finance
Reports To: Head of Audit / CFO

Job Summary


	The Senior Auditor oversees and manages full audit cycles, including planning, execution, and reporting.
